banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How a truck driver sees and saves people on America's highways
videoData.socialTitle: How a truck driver sees and saves people on America's highways

nodes.whoTheyAre: Since joining UPS Freight in 2005, John McKown has driven more than two million accident-free miles. He is proud to share his knowledge about highway safety with the nation’s youth as a Road Team Captain, a title bestowed on a select group of exemplary drivers by the American Trucking Association. His experience on the road has also made him aware of the devastating problem of human trafficking on America’s highways—and has made him an ally in the fight to stop it.

videoData.description: Human trafficking is a little known and practically invisible problem plaguing highways across the US. Truck driver and former police officer John McKown has made it his mission to be an activist on the road and implores all drivers of vehicles big and small to join him in protecting the approximately 293,000 children at risk of enslavement. In this eye-opening talk, McKown passionately advocates for others not to turn a blind eye and shares some easy ways to get you started as an ally on America's highways.
